rComments: Not a good professor at all. Lectures were not helpful as he is very difficult to understand. He also speaks more about the history of Economics instead of Economics

Took him Winter Quarter for ECON100A. You can tell that he is really passionate and knowledgeable about the subject however he is not a good lecturer at all. Halfway through the quarter very few people attended his class.Gave 3 midterms and 1 final which were easy thanks to the TA's review sessions which were nearly identical to the tests.

Did not provide an email for students to email questions. Does not express himself clearly in class. I have no idea what he is saying. His homework consists of quizzes online on material he has not taught yet and is not covered in resources provided and each question needs to be answered correctly the FIRST time for full credit.
bad professor. Very rude and mean.

Really poor lecturer in terms of delivery. Class is extremely boring. But the content is quite fascinating if you like history/economics, and you can learn a lot if you read and get into it. He is a master at this stuff and it's enjoyable to learn about.

Elbaum is pretty awesome. He applies material being learned in the textbook to to relevant issues today. This makes the class very interesting. You need to do well on your hw (electronic) which is not hard to do. His exams are very fair and he does not try to trick you. If you do your homework, go to class/review sessions this class is easy.

This guy is WEEIRRD but in a good way. He's really funny and his quirkyness keeps you engaged and interested. Kind of a hard class, but if you study and pay attention you will do fine. SUCH A FUNNY CHARACTER. Its worth taking this class just for that.
A good professor. His frequent tangents about the current economy made the otherwise book centered class tolerable. Not a challenging class, as long as you do the homework.

Most of the topics were very interesting. He went into a lot of tangents but material was applicable to the current economy. Only flaw is his TESTS! He gives tricky MC questions, which account for a third or half the grade. Also don't plan on leaving early for any vacation.. he gives a guiz the day before break.

I think Elbaum is a great professor. His voice is something you have to get used to, but he's a super smart dude who clearly knows his stuff. I thought his class was really interesting, and  enjoyed his lectures overall. Midterm, final, and one very short paper are the requirements...so not very difficult. Take 125/126 with him if you can.

He is a quirky guy but I grew to like him. I was very interested in the material, but his monotonous tone put even me to sleep; I had to stock up on Rockstar drinks to stay lucid. Still, I would take him again. Easy class. Sort of hard to get an A but easy to get a B.

Honestly, this class is incredibly easy! I got a B for practically doing nothing! 1 midterm, 1 paper (1 and a half page long) and one final. He gives you the study sheet before the test, which, you can get the answers from review. Basic memorization. If you can't pass this class, you're an insult to idiots everywhere in the world!!! Enough said!

Dr. Elbaum is a great professor with expansive wealth of knowledge in this subject. It's a shame people write "do not take" so other students change their schedules and miss very valuable information. The TAs were exceptionally motivated . Great PowerPoint slides from prof and TAs if you don't make your own reading outlines. Do not miss this class!
Pretty bad, do not take.

He is incredibly smart and a great lecturer. I recommend taking Econ history classes with him as security markets was pretty bland but then I wasn't relaly interested. Slides are helpful for exams but just listening to him lecture is the best. His laugh is great too!
I can see Elbaum as the evil mastermind of the next Batman movie; his scornful tone will leave you in need of a strong drink after every class.
An incredible professor. motivating, interesting and applies problems to real life situations.

Great teacher. Incredibly knowledgeable. Very straightforward, will not put any curveballs on tests. You must understand the material to get an A, i.e. go to lecture. Definitely take this class! GREAT teacher
The most interesting professor I've had.  Kids will show up to his class who aren't even taking it, just to listen to him.

A humorous guy, very easy-going and knowledgeable. Should always attend class, he doesn't always talk about all the slides. What's important is what he says, not what is written, they are old slides. No homework but there are essays, a midterm, and final.

Enjoyed his teaching style. This guy knows his stuff, the information he expounds is enlightening and fun. I enjoyed his class thoroughly. The questions he asks in class are had to answer if you haven't done the reading. Good teacher.
he is a decent teacher.  just show up to class on time, dont ask questions that were explained in the readings and laugh at his bad jokes.  tests are easy and papers are a joke.

rude, unkind, mocks the students, scoffs if you have a question, very opinionated, kackles. I still got an A=print out the slides and take good notes b/c he doesn't wait for you to finish before he goes to the next slide
No Comments
GREAT Teacher! Great class material, and if you got to class and read the material you will for sure get an A. During class he is rather intimidating, he is really nice at office hours though.

Prof has strange voice and might be intimidating, but he brings out good discussion. Lectures decent, considering its history. If you're tired of 100A/100B stuff, take the class! It's refreshingly different. No graphs, short run, etc. Essay (1pg) and exams not so bad. Straight Forward & Recommended!

A very experienced & engaging professor. I've never seen a professor stir interest in students during lectures like he does. Class is never boring. He expects lots of classroom participation and feedback. Tests are predictable and Extra credit assignments are available.  Excellent teacher in my opin

WACK!!! this prof is pretentious, inconsiderate, and rude. he cuts students off and makes people feel stupid. if you are looking to learn something, don't take him. however, if you are looking for one of those waste of time, i need some sleep so i go to class class, then elbaum is your man.

If you can write to the point and can memomrize a bunch of answers, you'll be ok. He gives all the questions that could be asked on the test in advance, and lets you answer 2 out of 3. So all you have to do is look things up in the book, memorize them, and rewrite them on the test.

I had this guy for a very random class,"Wall St. and the Money Game".  It was moderatley interesting but his insanely bizzare voice and laughter were both hilarious and hypnotizing, making it the only reason to come to class.  I would not want to tyr to learn serious subjuect matter from this guy.

Comes across as being a bit arrogant and rude.  Decent lecturer (although I found the subject matter boring) but has a very strange voice, almost like Kermit the frog but deeper.  Overall, I didn't care too much for him, but he graded on a big curve, making the class a bit easier.
horrible, borring lecture, expects everyone to be a genuis cause he has a PHD from Harvard, ****

If you are some sort of genius, you'll be okay but if you resemble normalness, too bad for you and me. He expects you to know every aspect of Econ Hist before he teaches it to you. Watch out for the attendance quizes...those ****s. Horrible dull lectures with his pretty nasal voice

125 IS SO EASY, MUST TAKE IT IF ECON MAJOR.. tests consist of prior questions, just memorize the questions and you will get an A! Elbaum is funny and smart, listen to him and you will learn about real  economics

To all the students who complain that B.E. spends too much time talking about "what to trade" and the current financial state of the US: He's an economic history professor, these are valuable insights coming from him! Fed Chairman Ben Bernake is the same sort of economic historian. Elbaum is telling you what's up! WRITE IT DOWN!
maybe the worst teacher i ever had, just maybe, he spent the first 2 weeks crying about the iraq war, which he knows NOTHING ABOUT, only what he sees on msnbc, no homework, book sucks.
I can sum this teacher up with one quote... "I invested in gold... and I won!!!"

Please take this class Pass/No Pass.  It is a lot of work for a General Ed.  Professor doesn't like questions.  His midterm was difficult/confusing.  You must show up to class to take quizzes and he has given two quizzes in one day to check attendance.  Be careful.

Very interesting teacher who has an immense background in his subject. He is absolutely hilarious even when he doesn't try to be. He talks loud and has a weird voice which keeps you awake in class. He always tells us that this is the most important class we will take in our 4 years... I am starting to agree with him.

The class is pretty easy if you can cram well for the tests, which are made up of questions that he gives to you. The only problem is you only have a couple days to memorize the answers, which can prove to be difficult. Otherwise the class is very interesting, and he is obviously very passionate about the material

WORST TEACHER EVER!  Gives pop quizzes, gives out exams questions weekend before exam, but involves student cramming if you don't follow his ridiculous hw reading schdule.  I'm a great student who almost failed the course, my advice: stay away.

Great lecturer. Had all kinds of insightful points and a very different perspective on history.  He is harsh, however, and has little patience for inane questions.  Conversely, he gets very enthusiastic when a student brings up a good point; really, he just has strong reactions to everything, but you can learn a ton in his class if youre willing to

WORST CLASS EVER! DO NOT TAKE unless you love to read about economies around the world.  Only way to pass is pass his lame essay and read a million different articles.  Section is mandatory, pop quizzes all the time...DON'T TAKE UNLESS HAVE TO!!!
i love elbaum!  he's awesome.  the reading is pretty important for keeping on track with him but its interesting so its not bad.
Worst jokes, uninteresting, everyone would be asleep in this class. Did not learn much if any.

This guy is from Harvard? You must be kidding me. Doesn't teach at all. Constantly talks about how he trades and what he thinks. Goes through slides quickly so he can talk more about stocks. Made us do a stocktrak game and answer questions so he could get investment info from us. If you take this class be prepared to learn on your own.

Very interesting lectures! Even though he brings powerpoint to class, he only follows it half the time. The rest of the time he talks about interesting stuff. Notes are posted online. Tons of reading though. One mindterm and one final, both essay tests; though questions are posted ahead of time. One short writing assignment.

Bernard Elbaum is well-qualified in his field and extremely intelligent. He's engaging, but beware - if you're wrong about something he'll point out just how WRONG you are. Which isn't bad, a student should be able to take a little criticism and not wilt in humiliation. Overall, he's hilarious  and passionate about economics.
knows his sht. interesting class. it's true, he walks the fine line between confident and ****, but in the end he's a good guy and good prof

attendance isn't mandatory, but there are pop quizzes every few weeks to make sure you've kept up on the reading. very knowledgable professor, pretty funny and charismatic as well. i didn't find him to be condescending at all - not afraid to tell a student they had a wrong answer, but never conveyed it in an intimidating way. recommended.
some people should not be teachers, they may be knowledgeable in their field but they lack people skills, Elbaum is an ass. avoid if you can

Very charismatic (but admittedly condescending) professor. Investing the effort to do everything he asks resulted in learning A LOT. But doing just half of what he expects will still get you an A!  If you get past his weird voice, his lectures are intruiging - 1.5 hours fly by.  He's got a bit of a bite to him; probably not such an approachable guy

The professor is intimidating and unapproachable. He cuts student's questions off and lacks attentiveness. It is easy, however, to get an "A" in the class if you do the reading, prepare for the question keys that he posts five days prior to the exams, and let him review your essay before it is due. You just have to put with him for an "A".
